TopicTitle: Cool New Planetary Astrophysics Papers on arXiv

Articles.Content:
I was bored, so, being an absolute nerd, I decided to browse arXiv for any cool new research papers published in the "Planetary Astrophysics" section. I was not disappointed. Here are my favorites that I think are worth checking out. Anyone can also post any interesting papers they find on the site as well.

ExoSOFT, a promising program used for efficient radial velocity data fitting: https://arxiv.org/abs/1711.03595

EPIC 246393474 b, a large iron-rich Super Earth orbiting an orange dwarf every 6.7 hours: https://arxiv.org/abs/1711.02097

Analysis of the conditions facing the short-period Hot Jupiter WASP-103b: https://arxiv.org/abs/1711.02566

The most likely scenarios for Neptune's original moon system in order for Triton to be captured: https://arxiv.org/abs/1711.01581

Radial Velocity data for the GJ 9827 transiting planet system: https://arxiv.org/abs/1711.01359

Fifteen newly validated Kepler candidates in potentially habitable systems: https://arxiv.org/abs/1711.01267
